basics.name: Erin Patterson
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Biology with a minor in Computer Sciences in the Departments of Natural Sciences and Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

work.company: University of Hawaii at Manoa College of Tropical Agriculture and Human Resources
work.summary: Engaged in a conservation biology lab, utilizing computer science and machine learning to develop innovative machinery for conservation efforts. Assisted in the design, programming, and deployment of devices, integrating technology with ecological research to enhance data accuracy and environmental impact.
highlights: Contributed to the development and implementation of advanced technology solutions, merging computer science and machine learning with conservation biology research
Assist in lab maintenance and fieldwork.
Maintained deployed machinery in the field, conducting regular checks and repairs to keep operations smooth and efficient, ensuring uninterrupted data collection.

work.summary: Expert in skincare-focused cosmetics, adept at educating customers on ingredient benefits and their interactions with the skin. Delivered personalized service, enhancing customer satisfaction and driving sales through informed consultations and up-to-date knowledge of industry trends.
highlights: Provided personalized skincare consultations, leveraging in-depth knowledge of cosmetic chemistry and ingredient efficacy to recommend tailored products for customers' specific skin concerns.
Educated customers on the interactions between skincare ingredients and skin health, enabling them to make informed purchasing decisions and achieve good results.
Contributed to sales growth through exceptional customer service, fostering trust and loyalty, and staying updated on industry trends to offer the latest skincare solutions.
